entry.title: Rhyothemis fuliginosa (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Rhyothemis fuliginosa (example pictured) is known as the "butterfly dragonfly"?

entry.title: reverse search warrants (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that some lawyers and privacy experts have questioned the constitutionality of reverse search warrants in the United States?

entry.title: Anne Makemie Holden (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Anne Makemie Holden bequeathed land to her male relatives so that they could vote?

entry.title: Gallic Wars (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Julius Caesar's portrayal of his actions in the Gallic Wars have led historians to call him one of history's first "spin doctors"?

entry.title: Lorenza Böttner (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Lorenza Böttner, a mouth and foot painter, had both of her arms amputated following an electric shock?

entry.title: A Song for Arbonne (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the 1992 book A Song for Arbonne is set in a fantasy world loosely based on 12th-century Provence?

entry.title: Steve Alm (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that former judge Steve Alm's successful campaign to be elected Prosecuting Attorney of Honolulu was endorsed by the State of Hawaii Organization of Police Officers in 2019?

entry.title: films directed by Umberto Lenzi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that after starring in several films directed by Umberto Lenzi, actor Me Me Lai later worked as a police officer who confiscated them as "video nasties"?
